definition: to fight together/to come to blows
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Still fighting, the two boys struggled in the water.
sentences.chinese: 兩個男孩邊廝打，邊在水中掙扎。

sentences.english: The dogs were fighting over a pearl.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗在爲一塊骨頭廝打。

sentences.english: But her experience of grappling with foreign powers is slighter than she often implies .
sentences.chinese: 但是，她與外國力量廝打的經驗比她經常暗示的要少。
她瘋狂而兇猛地廝打著。

sentences.english: There are two guys beating the hell out of each other in the street outside.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個傢伙在外面的大街上拼命地廝打。

sentences.english: I saw two women fighting on the street.
sentences.chinese: 我看到兩個婦女在街上廝打。

sentences.english: They often drank a lot and then they fought each other and beat the children.
sentences.chinese: 他們經常喝很多酒，然後就彼此廝打，揍孩子們。

sentences.english: The dog struggled fiercely with the wild cat.
